result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S Loll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain Absolute sobriety.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Jonathan L., Spencer K., Kimberly E. or J.A.E. (10/3/97)
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances w/out a valid prescription.
No drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of all prescriptions.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (bars, taverns, or liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Case 14CM894 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1109 and 14CF229.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon S Loll in court, in custody, with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.  State will not issue charges out of referral 14WK1577.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1: 
- Sentence Withheld for 3 years Probation consecutive to 14CF229  - 115 days credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail from 14CF229 and refund balance 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail from 14CF229 and refund balance
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with Jonathan L., Spencer K., Kimberly E. or JAE - DOB 10/03/1997.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX or drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of al RX.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  No Weapons(e.g. knives, firearms, etc.) .  DNA Sample if not yet provided.

Defense reserves right to expunction
Court will not grant expunction - Society will be harmed
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defense has not got a global offer from the State yet and requests another date for a plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
